intro: Calostephane foliosa, commonly known as the leafy calostephane, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Native to certain regions of South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
